author: Balgias

review: If you don't have a smart TV with Amazon videos, netflix, hulu, etc., this is definitely the best possible device you could buy. Super cheap and has a pretty decent wifi capabilities to stream HD content from the existing apps.BUT, if you want this primarily to mirror your browser or entire desktop (yes, you can do that with this device except the audio), this product is in serious beta stage. I tried to cast Hulu (not plus) and the audio was fine but the video was not HD at all. Same with Netflix. I was excited about their Beta feature of casting the entire desktop but realized that in that case the video is pretty decent, but it does not cast the audio to the TV speakers.If Google keeps updating the apps and the hardware, I will definitely give their version 2.0 another chance.

author: Evanllama18 "Evan"

review: I've been using an HDMI cord to stream YouTube and other media to my TV from my laptop. Now with Chromecast, I can ditch the cord...only for internet related streaming at least. I love being able to move my laptop around without worrying about yanking the HDMI cord out of the TV or laptop. However, it would be nice if it allowed streaming for other PC functionalities, such as, Word Processing, Saved photos, PPT, etc. It also needs tab streaming from smartphone or tablet. Otherwise, it's still a good product worth buying.Update (5/5/2014): I recently noticed that Chromecast now has a BETA test for streaming your entire desktop to the TV. It works good but has some lag. Hopefully it gets better as they continue to test it out.
